akn:section.akn:heading: Voluntary public access and habitat incentive program

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Establishment The Secretary shall establish a voluntary public access program under which States and tribal governments may apply for funding to encourage owners and operators of privately-held farm, ranch, and forest land to voluntarily make that land available for access by the public for wildlife-dependent recreation, including hunting or fishing under programs administered by the States and tribal governments.
(b) Applications In submitting applications for funding under the program, a State or tribal government shall describe—
(c) Priority In approving applications and awarding funding under the program, the Secretary shall give priority to States and tribal governments that propose—
(e) Regulations The Secretary shall promulgate such regulations as are necessary to carry out this section.
